Q.title: Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.
(Note that 1880 isn't exactly pre-industrial, but earlier data is highly unreliable, and there should really not have been much warming by then.)
Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible. Note that the data in the link is normalised relative to the 1951-1980 baseline, on which 1880 stands at -0.2. Therefore, the critical value to look for with this specific NASA dataset will be 1.8 ˚C. It is likely, though, that the link will no longer be active in a few decades, so a different dataset may have to be used anyway.
The last possible set of 5 years to satisfy the requirement would be 2095-2099, so the last possible resolution date would be around mid-2100, in order to make sure that there are no uncertainties regarding the 2099 climate data

Q.title: Will armed conflicts between the United States and the People's Republic of China lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2021 to January 1, 2050, either of the following occur:
There are at least three credible government sources reporting at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths.
There are at least three credible news reports that at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths.
These 100 deaths do not have to occur in the same conflict or the same year; it is sufficient for multiple separate events to reach a total of 100 deaths in this period.
This question will resolves as No otherwise.
In the context of this question, an armed conflict will be defined as a dispute that concerns a government and/or territory where the use of armed force between two parties, of which at least one is the government of a state, results in an exchange of weapon fire or detonations

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that both the United States and Israel recognize the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan before 2030, will Saudi Arabia normalize relations with Israel by 2031 if Iran does not get a nuclear bomb by then?
R_given_P_and_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both the United States and Israel recognize the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan before 01-01-2030, as reported by reliable media sources. Then, will Saudi Arabia normalize relations with Israel by 2031 if Iran does not get a nuclear bomb by then?

Resolution Criteria for P: This question will resolve positively if before 01-01-2030, reliable media sources report that both the United States of America and Israel have recognized the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan.

Resolution Criteria for Q: If the Iran nuke question resolves negatively (i.e., the Iranian Regime credibly states it has a nuclear weapon or a weapon test, as judged by media reports), then this question will resolve positively if at least five reliable media outlets report that the State of Israel is legally recognized by the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia before 2031-01-01, and negatively otherwise. Recognition is generally considered valid if it is declared by law, or declared through a large international body such as the United Nations. If the Iran nuke question resolves positively or ambiguously, this question resolves ambiguously.

P.title: Will US greenhouse gas emissions be halved by 2030?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question resolves positively if there is any year between 2022 and 2030 (inclusive) in which the US levels of economy-wide net greenhouse gas emissions (in terms of CO₂ equivalents) is at least 50.00% lower than 2005 levels, according to a reliable source that is not heavily disputed by other reliable sources. The question resolves negatively if all reliable reports (that Metaculus users can find) say that the US net emissions in each year between 2022 and 2030 were greater than 50% of 2005 levels, and there is at least one reliable report about net emission levels in 2030. (If there is no report about net emission levels in 2030, we should wait for one rather than resolving this question ambiguously.)
If the US gains or loses territories between now and 2030, ideally only the net emissions from the current territories should be considered

Q.title: Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.
(Note that 1880 isn't exactly pre-industrial, but earlier data is highly unreliable, and there should really not have been much warming by then.)
Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible. Note that the data in the link is normalised relative to the 1951-1980 baseline, on which 1880 stands at -0.2. Therefore, the critical value to look for with this specific NASA dataset will be 1.8 ˚C. It is likely, though, that the link will no longer be active in a few decades, so a different dataset may have to be used anyway.
The last possible set of 5 years to satisfy the requirement would be 2095-2099, so the last possible resolution date would be around mid-2100, in order to make sure that there are no uncertainties regarding the 2099 climate data

Q_given_P.title: Given US greenhouse gas emissions are halved by 2030, will commercial animal farming be prohibited in the US before 2041?
Q_given_P.body:
Resolution Criteria for P:
This question resolves positively if there is any year between 2022 and 2030 (inclusive) in which the US levels of economy-wide net greenhouse gas emissions (in terms of CO₂ equivalents) is at least 50.00% lower than 2005 levels, according to a reliable source that is not heavily disputed by other reliable sources. (If there is no report about net emission levels in 2030, we should wait for one rather than resolving this question ambiguously.)
If the US gains or loses territories between now and 2030, ideally only the net emissions from the current territories should be considered.

Resolution Criteria for Q:
This question will resolve as Yes if the US government passes legislation or the US constitution has been amended or interpreted by the Supreme Court to prohibit commercial animal farming before December 31, 2040.
Fine Print
Commercial Animal farming is considered to be the branch of agriculture involving animals that are raised for the commerce of meat, fibre, milk, eggs, or other physical products. For example, dairy cows should count as animal farming, but not pet chickens or animals kept in zoos for entertainment purposes. Both aquaculture (fish-farming) and fishing for wild fish should also count for resolution of this question.

Resolution Criteria
This question resolves positively if all of the following occur:
(a) There is any year between 2022 and 2030 (inclusive) in which the US levels of economy-wide net greenhouse gas emissions (in terms of CO₂ equivalents) is at least 50.00% lower than 2005 levels, according to a reliable source that is not heavily disputed by other reliable sources. (c) Both Washington DC and Puerto Rico are not officially admitted as new states before December 31, 2029, and the Republican Party controls the Senate from the beginning of the congressional term in 2023 to the end of the congressional term in 2031 (the 118th through 121st congresses, inclusive). Fine Print
Commercial Animal farming is considered to be the branch of agriculture involving animals that are raised for the commerce of meat, fibre, milk, eggs, or other physical products. For example, dairy cows should count as animal farming, but not pet chickens or animals kept in zoos for entertainment purposes. Both aquaculture (fish-farming) and fishing for wild fish should also count for resolution of this question.

para_P.title: By 2030, will the United States reduce its greenhouse gas emissions by 50%, will there be a ban on commercial animal agriculture in the US prior to 2041, and if Washington DC and Puerto Rico are not recognized as new states, will the Republican Party maintain control of the Senate from 2022 through 2030?
para_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if all of the following conditions are met:
(a) There exists at least one year from 2022 to 2030 (inclusive) where the overall net greenhouse gas emissions in the US (measured in CO₂ equivalents) are at least 50.00% below the levels recorded in 2005, based on a credible source that is not significantly contested by other trustworthy sources. The question will be deemed negative if all credible reports (accessible to Metaculus users) indicate that the US net emissions in every year from 2022 to 2030 exceeded 50% of the 2005 levels, and there is at least one reliable report regarding net emission levels in 2030. (In the absence of a report on net emissions for 2030, we will await one instead of resolving this question with uncertainty.) Should the US acquire or lose territories prior to 2030, ideally only the net emissions from the existing territories should be evaluated.
(b) Legislation is enacted by the US government, or the US Constitution is amended or interpreted by the Supreme Court to outlaw commercial animal farming prior to December 31, 2040.
(c) Neither Washington DC nor Puerto Rico is officially recognized as new states before December 31, 2029, and the Republican Party retains control of the Senate from the beginning of the congressional term in 2023 until the conclusion of the congressional term in 2031 (covering the 118th to 121st congresses, inclusive). If the Republicans lose control of the Senate at any point during this timeframe, the question will resolve as No. If both Washington DC and Puerto Rico are officially admitted to the United States on or before December 31, 2029, this question will be marked as Ambiguous.
Fine Print
Commercial animal farming refers to the sector of agriculture that deals with animals raised for the production of meat, fiber, milk, eggs, or other tangible products. For instance, dairy cows are included in animal farming, while pet chickens or animals housed in zoos for entertainment do not count. Both aquaculture (fish farming) and wild fish harvesting are also relevant for the resolution of this question.

Q.title: Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.
(Note that 1880 isn't exactly pre-industrial, but earlier data is highly unreliable, and there should really not have been much warming by then.)
Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible. Note that the data in the link is normalised relative to the 1951-1980 baseline, on which 1880 stands at -0.2. Therefore, the critical value to look for with this specific NASA dataset will be 1.8 ˚C. It is likely, though, that the link will no longer be active in a few decades, so a different dataset may have to be used anyway.
The last possible set of 5 years to satisfy the requirement would be 2095-2099, so the last possible resolution date would be around mid-2100, in order to make sure that there are no uncertainties regarding the 2099 climate data

P_and_Q.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) US greenhouse gas emissions be halved by 2030, (b) commercial animal farming be prohibited in the US before 2041, and (c) if Washington DC and Puerto Rico are not admitted as new states, will Republicans hold the Senate from 2022 to 2030, and will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question resolves positively if all of the following occur:
1. There is any year between 2022 and 2030 (inclusive) in which the US levels of economy-wide net greenhouse gas emissions (in terms of CO₂ equivalents) is at least 50.00% lower than 2005 levels, according to a reliable source that is not heavily disputed by other reliable sources.
2. The US government passes legislation or the US constitution has been amended or interpreted by the Supreme Court to prohibit commercial animal farming before December 31, 2040.
3. Both Washington DC and Puerto Rico are not officially admitted as new states before December 31, 2029, and the Republican Party controls the Senate from the beginning of the congressional term in 2023 to the end of the congressional term in 2031 (the 118th through 121st congresses, inclusive). If Republicans do not control the Senate at any point during that period, this question will resolve as No. If both Washington DC and Puerto Rico are officially admitted to the United States on or before December 31, 2029, this question will resolve as Ambiguous.
4. By January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.

P_or_Q.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The US greenhouse gas emissions be halved by 2030, commercial animal farming be prohibited in the US before 2041, and Republicans hold the Senate from 2022 to 2030? (b) There be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
P_or_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question resolves positively if either of the following occurs:
(a) All of the following occur:
   1. There is any year between 2022 and 2030 (inclusive) in which the US levels of economy-wide net greenhouse gas emissions (in terms of CO₂ equivalents) is at least 50.00% lower than 2005 levels, according to a reliable source that is not heavily disputed by other reliable sources. The question resolves negatively if all reliable reports (that Metaculus users can find) say that the US net emissions in each year between 2022 and 2030 were greater than 50% of 2005 levels, and there is at least one reliable report about net emission levels in 2030. If there is no report about net emission levels in 2030, we should wait for one rather than resolving this question ambiguously.
   2. The US government passes legislation or the US constitution has been amended or interpreted by the Supreme Court to prohibit commercial animal farming before December 31, 2040.
   3. Both Washington DC and Puerto Rico are not officially admitted as new states before December 31, 2029, and the Republican Party controls the Senate from the beginning of the congressional term in 2023 to the end of the congressional term in 2031 (the 118th through 121st congresses, inclusive). If Republicans do not control the Senate at any point during that period, this question will resolve as No. If both Washington DC and Puerto Rico are officially admitted to the United States on or before December 31, 2029, this question will resolve as Ambiguous.
(b) By January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.

Q_and_not_P.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) There will be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100, and (2) US greenhouse gas emissions will not be halved by 2030, commercial animal farming will not be prohibited in the US before 2041, and if Washington DC and Puerto Rico are admitted as new states, Republicans will not hold the Senate from 2022 to 2030?
Q_and_not_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if (a) by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880, and (b) at least one of the following occurs: (i) There is no year between 2022 and 2030 (inclusive) in which the US levels of economy-wide net greenhouse gas emissions (in terms of CO₂ equivalents) is at least 50.00% lower than 2005 levels, (ii) the US government does not pass legislation or the US constitution has not been amended or interpreted by the Supreme Court to prohibit commercial animal farming before December 31, 2040, or (iii) at least one of Washington DC or Puerto Rico is officially admitted as a new state before December 31, 2029, or the Republican Party does not control the Senate from the beginning of the congressional term in 2023 to the end of the congressional term in 2031. The question resolves negatively if (a) the average global temperature does not reach the specified threshold by 2100, or (b) at least one of the conditions in (b) is not met.

P.title: Will a new amendment to the US Constitution be ratified by 2050?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
The US Constitution has been amended 27 times in its history, most recently in 1992. This question resolves positively if at least five reliable media outlets report that before January 1st 2050 the US constitution received a 28th amendment. Otherwise it resolves negatively.
This question will close and resolve 1 hour before any 28th amendment becomes law, if one does.

para_P.body:
Resolution Criteria
Throughout its history, the US Constitution has undergone 27 amendments, with the latest being in 1992. This inquiry will be considered affirmative if a minimum of five credible news sources confirm that the US Constitution has been amended for the 28th time prior to January 1st, 2050. If this does not occur, the inquiry will be deemed negative.
This question will conclude and be resolved one hour before the enactment of any 28th amendment, should one be passed.

Q.title: Will armed conflicts between the United States and the People's Republic of China lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2021 to January 1, 2050, either of the following occur:
There are at least three credible government sources reporting at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths.
There are at least three credible news reports that at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths.
These 100 deaths do not have to occur in the same conflict or the same year; it is sufficient for multiple separate events to reach a total of 100 deaths in this period.
This question will resolves as No otherwise.
In the context of this question, an armed conflict will be defined as a dispute that concerns a government and/or territory where the use of armed force between two parties, of which at least one is the government of a state, results in an exchange of weapon fire or detonations

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on a new amendment to the US Constitution being ratified by 2050, will the United States continue to be among the 20 countries with the largest deterioration in state stability over the 2019-2029 period, according to the Fragile States Index?
Q_given_P.body:
Resolution Criteria for P:
The US Constitution has been amended 27 times in its history, most recently in 1992. This question resolves positively if at least five reliable media outlets report that before January 1st 2050 the US constitution received a 28th amendment. Otherwise it resolves negatively.
This question will close and resolve 1 hour before any 28th amendment becomes law, if one does.

Resolution Criteria for Q:
The Fragile State Index is an important metric of government stability. It is published every year here.
According to the 2019 report (see page 11), over the 2009 to 2019 period, The US was #12 among the countries with the most rapidly deteriorating Fragile States Index. The US was still among the more stable nations in the world but the trend was clearly in the direction of less stability.
Will the United States continue to be among the 20 countries with the largest deterioration in state stability over the 2019-2029 period, according to the Fragile States Index?
This question resolves positively if the United States is amongst the 20 countries with the largest long-term increase (worsening) of fragile state score over the 2019-2029 period.
If for some reason, Fund for Peace ceases to publish this index, or their index can no longer be compared historically this question will be ambiguous, unless the Fund For Peace designates a successor index that also shows which 20 countries have deteriorated the most over the period 2019 to 2029 from a standpoint of stability.
If the United States ceases to exist as a unified nation this question resolves positive.

The US Constitution has undergone 27 amendments throughout its history, with the latest occurring in 1992. Q.title: Will armed conflicts between the United States and the People's Republic of China lead to at least 100 deaths before 2050?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2021 to January 1, 2050, either of the following occur:
There are at least three credible government sources reporting at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths.
There are at least three credible news reports that at least one exchange of weapon fire between the national military forces or law enforcement personnel of the United States and the People's Republic of China causing a total of at least 100 deaths.
These 100 deaths do not have to occur in the same conflict or the same year; it is sufficient for multiple separate events to reach a total of 100 deaths in this period.
This question will resolves as No otherwise.
In the context of this question, an armed conflict will be defined as a dispute that concerns a government and/or territory where the use of armed force between two parties, of which at least one is the government of a state, results in an exchange of weapon fire or detonations

The US Constitution has been modified 27 times throughout its history, with the latest amendment occurring in 1992. This question will be deemed true if at least five trustworthy news sources report that the US Constitution acquired a 28th amendment prior to January 1st, 2050. If not, it will be considered false.
This question will conclude and resolve one hour before any 28th amendment is enacted, if such an amendment occurs.

Will the United States persist in being among the 20 nations with the most pronounced decline in state stability from 2019 to 2029, according to the Fragile States Index?

Should the Fund for Peace stop publishing this index, or if the index can no longer be historically compared, this question will become ambiguous, unless the Fund for Peace designates an alternative index that also identifies which 20 countries have deteriorated the most in terms of stability during the 2019 to 2029 period.
If the United States ceases to exist as a unified entity, this question will be considered true.

This question will be answered affirmatively if, at any point between January 1, 2019 and January 1, 2025, the Second Amendment is repealed, amended, or altered in any manner through the process outlined in Article Five of the US Constitution.

Q.title: Will there be at least 2˚C of global warming by 2100?
Q.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if, by January 1, 2100, there has been a period of at least 5 consecutive years in which the average global temperature in each year was at least 2.0 ˚C greater than the average global temperature in 1880.
(Note that 1880 isn't exactly pre-industrial, but earlier data is highly unreliable, and there should really not have been much warming by then.)
Data for resolution shall come from NASA, if possible. Note that the data in the link is normalised relative to the 1951-1980 baseline, on which 1880 stands at -0.2. Therefore, the critical value to look for with this specific NASA dataset will be 1.8 ˚C. It is likely, though, that the link will no longer be active in a few decades, so a different dataset may have to be used anyway.
The last possible set of 5 years to satisfy the requirement would be 2095-2099, so the last possible resolution date would be around mid-2100, in order to make sure that there are no uncertainties regarding the 2099 climate data
